result.execSummary:
The defendant Nora Zylstra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
11-17-2014 / Judge Jeffrey Wagner       
*The Court ordered that the restitution order be amended to include the Crime Victim Compensation Fund for reimbursement of $2,000.00, paid to Susan G., for the grave lot.
*********************



$1,849.82 payable to Susan G.

Provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay appropriate costs.  Pay all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge, and restitution.  DOC to collect from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervison.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and voting privleges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

Defendant Nora Zylstra in court with attorney Pamela Moorshead.  Defendant Nora Zylstra in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for motion hearing. Defendant appeared via video conference. Defense moves to withdraw postconviction motion for plea withdrawal. Attorney Pamela Moorshead in court, defendant Nora Zylstra not in court, in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel requests that the defendant testify by video and not be physically produced. State objects. Court DENIES defense counsel request. Court prefers that the defendant be produced. Case adjourned for motion hearing for postconviction discovery in Branch 38. Motion hearing scheduled for June 1, 2018 at 08:15 am. records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nora Zylstra in court with attorney Deborah S Vishny  and Bridget Krause.  Defendant Nora Zylstra in custody.  Mark S Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  The Court has reviewed all letters submitted.   Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by Susan G., Lucas F., Owen Z., Kathryn G.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 35 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 86 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 25 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  
The defendant stipulates to restitution in the amount of $1849.82 payable to Susan G.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
FAILURE TO PAY ALL COSTS, ASSESSMENTS, SURCHARGES AND RESTITUTION  WILL RESULT IN ENTRY OF CIVIL JUDGMENT.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is remanded.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement filed.
All letters submitted to the Court for its review are contained in the court file.

To the amended charge:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant  examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Court remands the defendant for sentencing on 6-3-2014 at 10am.

Defendant Nora Zylstra in court with attorney Deborah S Vishny and Bridget Krause.  Defendant Nora Zylstra in custody.  Mark S Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Lucy Kronforst also appears for the state.
In chambers conference held as to the time available to complete plea and sentencing this afternoon; ADA Williams is still in a trial in Branch 12.  Also, there have been numerous letters submitted to the court for its review this morning and the court has not had the opportunity to read them in their entirety.  The court will take the plea today and adjourn the sentencing to 10am on 6-3-2014.
Amended information filed charging First Degree Reckless Homicide, a class B felony pursuant to 940.02(1).
Sentencing materials, received and filed. cmt
on behalf of defendant (2), received and filed. cmt
received on behalf of defendant (2), filed. cmt
Counsels are requesting a plea/sentencing date of 6-2-2014 at 1:30pm.
Atty Deja Vishny contacts the court and cancels bail hearing set for 4-25-2014.
At request of defense counsel matter is calendared for BAIL REVIEW on 4-25-2014 at 8:15am.   ADA Mark Williams is present when date is set.  Defendant's appearance is waived.

Defendant Nora Zylstra in court with attorney Deborah S. Vishny and Bridget Krause.  Defendant Nora Zylstra in custody.  Mark S. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information previously filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.    Case set for final pretrial on 6-30-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 8-11-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 5-9-2014. 
If there is going to be a change in plea status it is to be done by 5-9-2014.
Evidentiary issues to be heard on final pretrial date.

Defendant Nora Zylstra in court with attorney Deborah S. Vishny and Bridget Krause. Defendant Nora Zylstra in custody.  Mark S. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Arraignment scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Nora Zylstra in court with attorney Bridget J. Krause.  Defendant Nora Zylstra in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
